answers.answer: It's good you're being careful with your diet, but be careful you're eating enough calories. I used to habitually watch what I ate because I easily gain weight, but in pregnancy we need a good 2000 calories at least. As long as you're getting enough calories and eating all the important things, I wouldn't worry too much unless your doctor says you're pretty underweight for your stage of pregnancy. Women gain weight in pregnancy in whatever way makes sense for their bodies.
I'm 25 weeks and haven't gained any weight either in fact I have lost weight since been pregnant. Not a lot tho but jus been eating healthy so I figuure that as long as your eating healthy your good
Thanks keep me updated if you gain any weight in the last months.
I'm right at 37 weeks and still -3 lbs from when I found out I was pregnant.

question: Am 24weeks and have not gained weight. I was diagnosed with gestational diabetes  since 18 weeks so ive been watching my carbs i eat.  i also had gained excessive weight right  before i got pregnant. i saw my doctor and she had the nerve to ask me if i was starving myself. i eat 3 times a day and snack three. my ultrasound showed mt baby was 12 oz. Why am i not gaining weight.
title: not gaining weight
